text: The 1977 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in San Cristóbal, Venezuela in 1977.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Twelve events were contested, 10 for men (3 for professionals, 7 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Professional Events |- |Men's sprint | Kōichi Nakano || Yoshi Sugata || John Nicholson |- | |Gregor Braun || Knut Knudsen || Steve Heffernan |- |Men's motor-paced | Cees Stam || Wilfried Peffgen || Pietro Algeri |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- | |Lothar Thoms || Günther Schumacher || Hans Ledermann |- |Men's sprint | Hans-Jürgen Geschke ||Emanuel Raasch || Lutz Hesslich |- | | Norbert Dürpisch || Uwe Unterwalder || Daniel Gisiger |- |Men's team pursuit | Norbert Dürpisch Gerald Mortag Matthias Wiegand Volker Winckle || Günther Schumacher Peter Vonhof Hans Lutz Henry Rincklin || Robert Dill-Bundi Daniel Gisiger Hans Kaenel Walter Baumgartner |- |Men's points race |Constant Tourné || Jan Faltyn || Nikolaï Makarov |- |Men's motor-paced | Gaby Minneboo || Bartolome Caldentey || Rainer Podlesch |- |Men's tandem | Vladimir Vackar Miloslav Vymazal|| Vladimir Semenets Aleksander Voronine || Horst Gewis Wolfgang Schaffer |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Galina Tsareva |Sue Novara |Iva Zajikova |- |Women's individual pursuit |Vera Kuznetsova |Anna Riemersma |Karen Strong |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1977 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by Venezuela Category:1977 in track cycling
title: 1977 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
